meanings.definition: One who forms an opinion or conjecture about something without sufficient evidence.
meanings.sent1: The surmiser guessed the answer without any proof.
meanings.sent2: The surmiser thought the movie would be good even though they hadn't seen the trailer.
meanings.sent3: The surmiser believed the rumor that aliens were coming to visit.
meanings.sent4: The surmiser's mind was like a detective, always trying to solve mysteries without clues.
meanings.sent5: The surmiser's hunches were often right, even though they couldn't explain why.

meanings.definition: To form an opinion or conjecture about something without sufficient evidence.
meanings.sent1: She would often surmise the outcome of the game before it even started.
meanings.sent2: He surmised that it would rain based on the dark clouds in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The detective surmised that the butler was the culprit, but he was wrong.
meanings.sent4: The teacher surmised that the student was cheating because of the sudden increase in grades.
meanings.sent5: The scientist surmised that the experiment would fail, but was pleasantly surprised when it succeeded.
